CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Figure 7 shows the current - voltage ( J-V ) characteristics of the ITO / PEDOT : PSS / polymer : PC71BM / LiF / Al devices.

Let's think step by step.

1. ITO: Indium Tin Oxide
2. PEDOT : PSS: PEDOT:PSS (Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene):poly(styrenesulfonate)
3. polymer: Unspecified type of polymer
4. PC71BM: Poly(3-hexylthiophene-2,5-diyl-alt-[6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester)
5. LiF: Lithium Fluoride
6. Al: Aluminum.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

1. ITO: Indium Tin Oxide
2. PEDOT : PSS: PEDOT:PSS (Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene):poly(styrenesulfonate)
3. PC71BM: Poly(3-hexylthiophene-2,5-diyl-alt-[6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester)
4. LiF: Lithium Fluoride
5. Al: Aluminum.

These are the entities in the paragraph that clearly refer to material names.

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Figure 7 shows the current - voltage ( J-V ) characteristics of the ITO / PEDOT : PSS / polymer : PC71BM / LiF / Al devices.

Let's think step by step.

1. ITO: Indium Tin Oxide (an electrode material)
2. PEDOT : PSS: Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene):poly(styrenesulfonate) (a conducting polymer)
3. polymer: Unspecified type of polymer
4. PC71BM: Poly(3-hexylthiophene-2,5-diyl-alt-[6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester) (a fullerene derivative)
5. LiF: Lithium Fluoride (a compound used as an electron transport layer)
6. Al: Aluminum (a metal used as a contact layer)
7. J-V: Current-voltage (a property of electrical circuits)
8. characteristics: The way a device behaves under different current and voltage conditions (a property of a device)
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

1. ITO: Indium Tin Oxide (an electrode material)
2. PEDOT : PSS: Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene):poly(styrenesulfonate) (a conducting polymer)
3. polymer: Unspecified type of polymer (a material)
4. PC71BM: Poly(3-hexylthiophene-2,5-diyl-alt-[6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester) (a fullerene derivative) (a material)
5. LiF: Lithium Fluoride (a compound) (a material)
6. J-V: Current-voltage (a property of electrical circuits)
7. characteristics: The way a device behaves under different current and voltage conditions (a property)

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| Indium Tin Oxide (ITO) |
| Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene):poly(styrenesulfonate) (PEDOT : PSS) |
| Unspecified type of polymer |
| Poly(3-hexylthiophene-2,5-diyl-alt-[6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester) (PC71BM) |
| Lithium Fluoride (LiF) |
| Current-voltage (J-V) |
| The way a device behaves under different current and voltage conditions (characteristics) |

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Figure 7 shows the current - voltage ( J-V ) characteristics of the ITO / PEDOT : PSS / polymer : PC71BM / LiF / Al devices.

Let's think step by step.

1. ITO: Indium Tin Oxide, a type of conductive oxide material.
2. PEDOT: PSS: Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene): Poly(styrenesulfonate), a type of conducting polymer.
3. polymer: Unspecified type of polymer used in the device.
4. PC71BM: A specific type of organic material, likely a polymer or small molecule.
5. LiF: Lithium Fluoride, an inorganic compound.
6. Al: Aluminum, a metal used as an electrode material.

These entities can be considered as "Property Value" entities as they represent specific materials or substances used in the described ITO/PEDOT:PSS/polymer:PC71BM/LiF/Al devices.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. PC71BM: This entity refers to a specific material property, likely a polymer or small molecule used in the device.

This is the only entity in the paragraph that can be considered as a clear reference to a material property value. The other entities mentioned in the paragraph are types of materials or components used in the device, not properties of those materials.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.
